page.title: 01UPLANDS NEAR PICKERING
page.content: This area is higher above sea level than Pickering. In the east it is cut by Newton Dale through which passes Pickering Beck and the North Yorks Moor Railway, the dale is well wooded. At Farworth there is a small holding, this was the stabling place when the North Eastern Railway used to horse drawn coaches. Here lives Bert Eddon who still makes besoms using heather from the moors. Close by is Hagg Wood Marsh famous for Globe flowers. There is also a wooded area in the south west, this borders on a limestone quarry which produces materials for road making. The rest is farming country, mostly arable but also grassland for sheep and cattle. There are also pig and poultry farms. There are a few well kept farms and most of the central area, Blansby Park belongs to the Duchy of Lancaster. The area is
